events.originalText: Flydubai Flight 981 crashed during an aborted landing at Rostov-on-Don Airport, Russia, resulting in the deaths of all 62 passengers and crew on board.
events.subtitle: Flydubai Flight 981
events.headline: Flydubai Flight 981 crashes in Rostov-on-Don, Russia, killing all 62 on board

events.originalText: First Libyan Civil War: The French Air Force launched Opération Harmattan, beginning foreign military intervention in Libya.
events.subtitle: Libyan civil war (2011)
events.headline: French Air Force launches Opération Harmattan in First Libyan Civil War

events.originalText: The gamma-ray burst GRB 080319B (artist's impression pictured), the farthest object that could be seen by the naked eye, was observed.
events.subtitle: Gamma-ray burst
events.headline: Farthest object visible to naked eye observed: gamma-ray burst GRB 080319B

events.originalText: An unscheduled Ariana Afghan Airlines flight crashed into a mountain on approach into Kabul, killing all 45 people aboard.
events.subtitle: Ariana Afghan Airlines
events.headline: Ariana Afghan Airlines flight crashes in Kabul, claiming 45 lives

events.originalText: American televangelist Jim Bakker resigned as the host of The PTL Club in the midst of a sex scandal.
events.subtitle: Televangelism
events.headline: Jim Bakker resigns amid sex scandal from The PTL Club

events.originalText: The American cable television network C-SPAN, covering government proceedings and public-affairs programming, was launched.
events.subtitle: Cable television
events.headline: C-SPAN cable television network launched, covering government proceedings

events.originalText: Influential American musician Bob Dylan  released his eponymous debut album, mainly comprising traditional folk, blues and gospel songs.
events.subtitle: Bob Dylan
events.headline: Bob Dylan releases debut album featuring traditional folk, blues, and gospel songs

events.originalText: The secular oratorio A Child of Our Time by Michael Tippett, premiered at the Adelphi Theatre in London.
events.subtitle: Oratorio
events.headline: A Child of Our Time oratorio by Michael Tippett premieres in London

events.originalText: The highly influential American radio comedy show Amos 'n' Andy made its debut.
events.subtitle: Radio comedy
events.headline: Amos 'n' Andy radio comedy show makes influential debut

events.originalText: Established by Clara Zetkin, Käte Duncker, and others, International Women's Day was first observed.
events.subtitle: Clara Zetkin
events.headline: International Women's Day first observed, established by Clara Zetkin

events.originalText: American Civil War: The last battle of the Carolinas Campaign, the Battle of Bentonville, began, which contributed to the ultimate Union victory in the war.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Battle of Bentonville begins, contributing to Union victory in American Civil War

events.originalText: American explorer Benjamin Morrell departed Antarctica after a voyage later plagued by claims of fraud.
events.subtitle: Benjamin Morrell
events.headline: Explorer Benjamin Morrell departs Antarctica amid fraud claims

events.originalText: King Charles IV of Spain was forced to abdicate in favour of his son Ferdinand VII as a result of the Tumult of Aranjuez.
events.subtitle: Charles IV of Spain
events.headline: King Charles IV of Spain abdicates in favor of son Ferdinand VII

events.originalText: The Edict of Amboise was signed, ending the first war in the French Wars of Religion and inaugurating a period of official peace that lasted until 1567.
events.subtitle: Edict of Amboise
events.headline: Edict of Amboise signed, ending first war in French Wars of Religion

events.originalText: Mongol conquest of Song China: Emperor Bing, the last emperor of the Song dynasty, drowned at the end of the Battle of Yamen, bringing the dynasty to an end after three centuries.
events.subtitle: Mongol conquest of the Song dynasty
events.headline: Emperor Bing drowns, ending Song dynasty at Battle of Yamen

events.originalText: The Byzantine Empire and the Republic of Venice signed a treaty that renegotiated and extended by two years a previous treaty between them.
events.subtitle: Byzantine Empire
events.headline: Byzantine Empire and Republic of Venice sign treaty extending previous agreement
